objects.name: Dynamic Analysis Evasion
objects.description: Malware may obstruct dynamic analysis in a sandbox, emulator, or virtual machine.

x_mitre_methods.definition: Overloads a sandbox by generating a flood of meaningless behavioral data. [[1]](#1)
x_mitre_methods.name: Data Flood

x_mitre_methods.definition: Inclusion of a demo binary/mode that is executed when token is absent or not enough privileged.
x_mitre_methods.name: Demo Mode

x_mitre_methods.definition: Original file is written to disk then executed. May confuse some sandboxes, especially if the dropped executable must be provided specific arguments and the original dropper is not associated with the drop file(s).
x_mitre_methods.name: Drop Code

x_mitre_methods.definition: Encode a file on disk, such as an implant's config file.
x_mitre_methods.name: Encode File

x_mitre_methods.definition: execution happens when a particular file or directory is accessed, often through hooking certain API calls such as CreateFileA and CreateFileW.
x_mitre_methods.name: Hook File System

x_mitre_methods.definition: modification of interrupt vector or descriptor tables.
x_mitre_methods.name: Hook Interrupt

x_mitre_methods.definition: Creates an illusion; makes the analyst think something happened when it didn't.
x_mitre_methods.name: Illusion
